metadata.title: plan:structured Example — Intermediate Hypertrophy Focus
metadata.description: Structured (parsed) version of the intermediate PPL hypertrophy plan. Demonstrates more complex periodization (block periodization with accumulation/intensification phases) and higher frequency (6 days/week) compared to beginner plan.

planStructured.name: Intermediate Hypertrophy Focus
planStructured.coreStrategy: 6-day Push/Pull/Legs split with volume accumulation for hypertrophy. High frequency per muscle group (2x/week) while managing fatigue through movement-pattern specificity. Uses block periodization: accumulation phase (increase volume) followed by intensification phase (increase load). Compound lifts (3-4 sets of 6-10 reps RPE 7-8), accessories (3-4 sets of 10-15 reps RPE 8-9), isolation (2-3 sets of 12-20 reps RPE 9).
progressionStrategy: Phase 1 (Weeks 1-6): Accumulation — Gradually increase volume from 12-14 sets per muscle group to 18-20 sets. Add 1-2 sets every 2 weeks. Intensity moderate (RPE 7-8).
Phase 2 (Weeks 7-8): Deload — Reduce volume by 50%, maintain exercise selection. Moderate intensity (don't push for PRs). Dissipate accumulated fatigue.

Phase 3 (Weeks 9-14): Intensification — Increase load/intensity while maintaining volume (14-16 sets per muscle group). Add 5-10lbs to compounds when hitting top of rep range. Intensity high (RPE 8-9). Incorporate rest-pause, drop sets, slow eccentrics on accessories.
Phase 4 (Weeks 15-16): Final Deload & Assessment — Reduce volume by 60%. Take progress photos, measurements, strength tests. Plan next training block.
Exercise Variation: Rotate exercises every 4-6 weeks to prevent accommodation (e.g., flat bench → incline bench).
planStructured.adjustmentStrategy: Scheduled deloads at Weeks 7-8 and 15-16. Cut volume by 50-60%, maintain exercise selection, keep intensity moderate (70-80% of working weights). Focus on technique refinement and recovery. Auto-regulation deload if needed mid-block: If 3+ consecutive sessions feeling flat, sleep disruption, or joint pain occurs, take 1 unscheduled deload week then resume.
conditioning: Optional Zone 2 cardio: 2-3x/week, 20-30min (bike, incline walk, rowing)
Purpose: Cardiovascular health, recovery enhancement, appetite regulation

scheduleTemplate.rationale: Start week fresh with pressing movements. Allows maximum energy for heavy compound pushing.
Antagonist pairing allows upper body recovery distribution. Back work complements Monday's pressing.
Mid-week leg session with quad/knee-dominant movements (squats, leg press, extensions).
Second push day with slightly different exercise selection. Focuses more on triceps and front delts.
Second pull day completes 2x frequency for back. More emphasis on rear delts and biceps volume.
Second leg day with posterior chain focus (RDLs, hip thrusts, leg curls). Complements Wednesday's quad work.
Complete rest or 20-30min easy cardio. Recover for Monday's push session.

qualityNotes: This intermediate example demonstrates more complex periodization compared to beginner plan: (1) Block periodization with distinct accumulation and intensification phases, (2) Higher training frequency (6 days vs 3 days), (3) More detailed progression strategy with specific set/rep/RPE targets for different phases, (4) Auto-regulation built in (scheduled deloads plus mid-block flexibility), (5) Exercise rotation strategy for preventing accommodation, (6) Volume targets per muscle group (14-20 sets), (7) Longer duration (16 weeks vs 12 weeks) to accommodate accumulation/intensification cycle.
